comment.author: 83979593@N00
comment._content: When we were scanning these lantern slides, we picked up the spelling of place names from the slides themselves. Understand that some of these slides date from the late 1800s to early 1900s, which may mean place names reflect the commonly used term for that time period (see NY Times article). It seems that Sudan has at different periods been governed by Egypt until 1956, when Sudan gained its independence. At the time of the photograph, Wadi Haifa was considered part of Egypt. Here’s a link to more information on the history of Sudan. We will add the current spelling to our records. -Ed and Angie, Archives Department, Brooklyn Museum
